ch.se.inf.ethz.jcd.batman.vdisk.impl

Class FreeBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.se.inf.ethz.jcd.batman.vdisk.impl.VirtualBlock
      • ch.se.inf.ethz.jcd.batman.vdisk.impl.FreeBlock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFreeBlock, IVirtualBlock

    public final class FreeBlock
extends VirtualBlock
implements IFreeBlock
    Implementation of IFreeBlock. The blocks need at least 32 byte to store the data needed for the free list. The data is structured as follows: 0x00 8 byte size and indicator for free block 0x08 8 byte offset position of the previous block in the list 0x10 8 byte offset position of the next block in the list 0xnn n garbage end 8 byte size and indicator for free block
    See Also:
    IVirtualBlock, IDataBlock

        disk - the disk on which the block is stored
        position - the offset position in bytes of the block

        the loaded block
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the block at the given position is invalid or if an I/O error occurs

                long position,
                long size,
                long previous,
                long next)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a free block at the given offset position.
        Parameters:
        disk - the disk on which the block is created
        position - the offset position in bytes of the block
        size - the size of the newly created block
        previous - the offset position of the previous block in the list
        next - the offset position of the next block in the list
        Returns:
        the created block
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • getNextBlock

        public long getNextBlock()
        Returns the position (address) of the next block inside the implicit doubly linked list of free blocks. The address is relative to the beginning of the virtual disk. Therefore position 0 is the first byte of the virtual disk.
        Specified by:
        getNextBlock in interface IFreeBlock
        Returns:
        position of the next free block, zero if there is none

      • setNextBlock

      • getPreviousBlock

        public long getPreviousBlock()
        Returns the position (address) of the previous block inside the implicit doubly linked list of free blocks. The address is relative to the beginning of the virtual disk. Therefore position 0 is the first byte of the virtual disk.
        Specified by:
        getPreviousBlock in interface IFreeBlock
        Returns:
        position of the previous free block, zero if there is none
